[{"type":"image","gridData":{"x":0,"y":0,"w":6,"h":10,"i":"e2fac839-d99c-453c-842c-a4d70f8fcbf9"},"panelIndex":"e2fac839-d99c-453c-842c-a4d70f8fcbf9","embeddableConfig":{"enhancements":{"dynamicActions":{"events":[]}},"imageConfig":{"src":{"type":"url","url":"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/H0wl3r/WOLF-VM/refs/heads/main/Images/wolf.png"},"altText":"","backgroundColor":"","sizing":{"objectFit":"contain"}}}},{"type":"visualization","gridData":{"x":6,"y":0,"w":42,"h":10,"i":"e14de631-52dd-4c9b-a7ee-53e934c9f084"},"panelIndex":"e14de631-52dd-4c9b-a7ee-53e934c9f084","embeddableConfig":{"savedVis":{"id":"","title":"","description":"","type":"markdown","params":{"fontSize":12,"openLinksInNewTab":false,"markdown":"# **Workstation Observation and Log Forensics**

Welcome to **WOLF** your comprehensive solution for analysing logs during Incident Response Investigations

WOLF will ingest `EVTX` and `PCAP` log formats and includes several dashboards to present the data. This VM integrates seamlessly with `Hayabusa`, providing an advanced pipeline for ingesting and processing `Hayabusa` logs, allowing for detailed forensic analysis.  

\
[[Hayabusa] Overview](http://wolf.local.vm:5601/app/dashboards#/view/64617368-626f-7264-6861-796162757361)   |   [[Windows] Overview](http://wolf.local.vm:5601/app/dashboards#/view/77696e2d-6f76-6572-6466-6972776f6c66)   |   [[Zeek]  Overview](http://wolf.local.vm:5601/app/dashboards#/view/7a65656b-6f76-6572-6466-6972776f6c66)



"},"uiState":{},"data":{"aggs":[],"searchSource":{"query":{"language":"kuery","query":""},"filter":[]}}},"enhancements":{},"hidePanelTitles":true,"description":""},"title":""},{"type":"visualization","gridData":{"x":0,"y":10,"w":9,"h":21,"i":"c292e07a-696a-417e-8dad-02a5e7b944c5"},"panelIndex":"c292e07a-696a-417e-8dad-02a5e7b944c5","embeddableConfig":{"savedVis":{"id":"","title":"","description":"","type":"markdown","params":{"fontSize":10,"openLinksInNewTab":false,"markdown":"## **How to ingest data**

#### Windows EVTX
- Transfer all EVTX logs to `C:\WOLF\Logs\WinLogs`
- Open PowerShell and run the function `WOLF-Import-WinLogs`
- Imported EVTX logs will be ingested in `winlogbeat-*` index
#### Hayabusa Analysis Logs
- Once Windows EVTX logs are ingest
- Open PowerShell and run the function `WOLF-Import-HayabusaLogs`
- Hayabusa conducts analysis on all EVTX logs located in `C:\WOLF\Logs\WinLogs`
- Hayabusa Analysis Logs will be ingested in to `hayabusa` index
#### PCAP
- Transfer PCAP files to `C:\WOLF\Logs\PCAP`
- Open PowerShell and run the function `WOLF-Import-PCAP`
- Zeek conducts analysis of all PCAP files
- Zeek analysis logs will be ingested to `filebeat-*` index
